The next step in your career after finishing your degree in Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) at Ryerson University would depend on your career goals and the type of position you are interested in. Some potential options may include:

1. Entry-level OHS positions such as a Health and Safety Coordinator, Assistant or Advisor. These roles typically involve implementing and monitoring safety procedures, providing training and education to employees, and conducting safety inspections and audits.
2. OHS Consultant: these roles are typically for individuals with more experience in the field. You would advise companies on how to comply with safety regulations and develop safety programs.
3. Specialized roles: You could choose to specialize in a specific area of OHS such as environmental health and safety, industrial hygiene, or ergonomics.
4. Management roles: As you gain more experience, you may be able to move into a management role such as a Health and Safety Manager, Director or Manager.
5. Starting your own OHS consulting company.

It's also a good idea to network with professionals in the field, and consider joining professional associations such as the Canadian Society of Safety Engineering (CSSE) or the Canadian Centre for Occupational Health and Safety (CCOHS) to stay up-to-date on industry developments, and connect with potential employers or clients.
